meanings.definition: A person who is impudent or cheeky.
meanings.sent1: Tommy is such a sauceboxes when he talks back to his teacher.
meanings.sent2: The little girl giggled and called her brother a sauceboxes for teasing her.
meanings.sent3: The sauceboxes at the party kept making jokes and teasing everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her little brother was a sauceboxes, always finding ways to annoy her.
meanings.sent5: The sauceboxes in the group always had a witty comeback ready.

meanings.sent1: Mom asked me to pass her the sauceboxes from the kitchen cabinet.
meanings.sent2: The chef grabbed the sauceboxes to drizzle the sauce over the dish.
meanings.sent3: The sauceboxes on the table was filled with delicious barbecue sauce.
meanings.sent4: She carefully poured the homemade sauce into the sauceboxes.
meanings.sent5: The sauceboxes clinked as she set it down on the counter.
